law.text:
The Legislature finds and declares that:
Excessive noise is a serious hazard to the public health and welfare and the quality of life.
A substantial body of science and technology exists by which excessive noise may be substantially abated.
Each person has a right to an environment free from noise that jeopardizes his health or welfare or degrades the quality of life or lowers property value.
It is the policy of the state to promote an environment for all people free from noise that jeopardizes their health or welfare or degrades the quality of life.
law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 99, sec. 2, effective June 21, 1974.
